description: A pimNeighborLoss notification signifies the loss of an
adjacency with a neighbor. This notification should be
generated when the neighbor timer expires, and the router
has no other neighbors on the same interface with the same
IP version and a lower IP address than itself.
This notification is generated whenever the counter
pimNeighborLossCount is incremented, subject
to the rate limit specified by
pimNeighborLossNotificationPeriod.
REFERENCE RFC 4601 section 4.3.2
The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor
of the local router.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimNeighborUpTime

description: A pimInvalidRegister notification signifies that an invalid
PIM Register message was received by this device.
This notification is generated whenever the counter
pimInvalidRegisterMsgsRcvd is incremented, subject to the
rate limit specified by
pimInvalidRegisterNotificationPeriod.
REFERENCE RFC 4601 section 4.4.2
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidRegister PIM-STD-MIB::pimGroupMappingPimMode i 1 PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidRegisterAddressType i 0 PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidRegisterOrigin s EXAM PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidRegisterGroup s EXAM PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidRegisterRp s EXAM

description: The PIM mode to be used for groups in this group prefix.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimGroupMappingPimMode

description: The address type stored in pimInvalidRegisterOrigin
pimInvalidRegisterGroup, and pimInvalidRegisterRp.
If no invalid Register messages have been received, then
this object is set to unknown(0).
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidRegisterAddressType

description: The source address of the last invalid Register message
received by this device.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidRegisterOrigin

description: The IP multicast group address to which the last invalid
Register message received by this device was addressed.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidRegisterGroup

description: The RP address to which the last invalid Register message
received by this device was delivered.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidRegisterRp

description: A pimInvalidJoinPrune notification signifies that an
invalid PIM Join/Prune message was received by this device.
This notification is generated whenever the counter
pimInvalidJoinPruneMsgsRcvd is incremented, subject to the
rate limit specified by
pimInvalidJoinPruneNotificationPeriod.
REFERENCE RFC 4601 section 4.5.2
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidJoinPrune PIM-STD-MIB::pimGroupMappingPimMode i 1 PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidJoinPruneAddressType i 0 PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidJoinPruneOrigin s EXAM PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidJoinPruneGroup s EXAM PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidJoinPruneRp s EXAM PIM-STD-MIB::pimNeighborUpTime t 31536000

description: The PIM mode to be used for groups in this group prefix.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimGroupMappingPimMode

description: The address type stored in pimInvalidJoinPruneOrigin
pimInvalidJoinPruneGroup, and pimInvalidJoinPruneRp.
If no invalid Join/Prune messages have been received, this
object is set to unknown(0).
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidJoinPruneAddressType

description: The source address of the last invalid Join/Prune message
received by this device.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidJoinPruneOrigin

description: The IP multicast group address carried in the last
invalid Join/Prune message received by this device.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidJoinPruneGroup

description: The RP address carried in the last invalid Join/Prune
message received by this device.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimInvalidJoinPruneRp

description: The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor
of the local router.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimNeighborUpTime

description: A pimRPMappingChange notification signifies a change to the
active RP mapping on this device.
This notification is generated whenever the counter
pimRPMappingChangeCount is incremented, subject to the
rate limit specified by
pimRPMappingChangeNotificationPeriod.
The PIM mode to be used for groups in this group prefix.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimGroupMappingPimMode

description: The precedence of this row, used in the algorithm that
determines which row applies to a given group address
(described above). Numerically higher values for this
object indicate lower precedences, with the value zero
denoting the highest precedence.
The absolute values of this object have a significance only
on the local router and do not need to be coordinated with
other routers.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimGroupMappingPrecedence

description: A pimInterfaceElection notification signifies that a new DR
or DF has been elected on a network.
This notification is generated whenever the counter
pimInterfaceElectionWinCount is incremented, subject to the
rate limit specified by
pimInterfaceElectionNotificationPeriod.
REFERENCE RFC 4601 section 4.3.2 and RFC 5015 section 3.5.2

event.Summary: New DR or DF elected on the network

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PIM-STD-MIB::pimInterfaceElection PIM-STD-MIB::pimInterfaceAddressType i 0 PIM-STD-MIB::pimInterfaceAddress s EXAM

description: The address type of this PIM interface.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimInterfaceAddressType

description: The primary IP address of this router on this PIM
interface. The InetAddressType is given by the
pimInterfaceAddressType object.
variables.name: PIM-STD-MIB::pimInterfaceAddress
